Reviews.Title: “Well worth the value and great time.”
Reviews.Author: GContact
Reviews.Content: Jeff Luderer, the hotel manager, was very helpfull the moment we arrived. We drove down San and didn't much on the area. Her took time out to tell me and my family done great places to eat and done trendy shopping areas. We will definitely will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best view of Venice beach”
Reviews.Author: erristattle
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a budget minded boutique hotel in the Santa Monica/Venice beach area. This is a good one. Its located right on the beachwalk. I think the rooms were just redone when we visiting in June 2011. It has an art deco feeling. The desk people are rather friendly. Aside the location, this hotel has one of the nicest roof top patios. Spent a few nights just hanging out on the rooftop looking at the beach and city skyline. The only drawback is limited parking (you have to give them your keys, in case they have to move your car). Also, if you have young children, it may get a bit noisy depending on your room and what is happening down at the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: Troy F
Reviews.Content: Great staff! Very friendly, personable, and informative. Amazing hotel, located steps away from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: 586carot23
Reviews.Content: My husband , daughter and I recently stayed at the Cadillac. We really enjoyed our stay. Venice Beach is quirky and interesting with some real characters around. The hotel itself is clean and comfortable and the staff were really helpful. Moses at the front desk was a real gem, nothing seemed to be a problem for him. With further developments planned, (breakfast facilities etc) this will only get better. Keep up the good work

Reviews.Title: “Funky”
Reviews.Author: YEGirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is clean and seems to be recently remodeled, but getting to it can be difficult. We booked this hotel through expedia without knowing the name so could not research it beforehand. We figured it was worth the chance as we were just staying one night before flying out of LAX. There is a small parking lot next to the hotel, though it fills up fast. We got the last spot thankfully, as it was my husband and I with our toddler, and traveling with kids means extra stuff to lug to the room. The room was nice, two double beds with a table and chair. The bathroom had a nice large shower. However there is no AC so we had to open the windows. We were at the back of the building and it wasn't as noisy as I expected. The beds are a bit hard and could use some extra pillows but my husband liked it as he prefers harder mattresses. The main attraction with this hotel is that it is right on the beach. Yes, you have to walk past a homeless camp to get to it, but they didn't bother us. We were able to spend the morning by the ocean and it was a good way to end our trip. All in all, a decent hotel, if I wanted to stay in the area I would go back, but it definitely is funky.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Zwinky1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite new and modern and so it looks, and is, very clean. There is no breakfast but the location is great, right at Venice beach front. (so it can be a bit noisy during the night.)

Reviews.Title: “It's on Venice Beach!”
Reviews.Author: kozad
Reviews.Content: Ignore old reviews. They have remodeled the place. It's very clean with nice firm beds. If the sight of homeless hippies bothers you, spend your big bucks in Santa Monica. Remember, this is Venice Beach! The characters are characters. Being right on the Pacific Ocean is what I wanted, and the roof is a great place to watch the sun go down. The front desk people are helpful, the coffee is good. The parking lot is very helpful: beach parking is difficult. Don't bring your Cadillac, though. The lot is for small cars. We had a fantastic stay there. Walk over to Lula on Main St. for great Mexican food. The little joint on the corner works for breakfast. The only problem might be in the summer: if you open your window, it might get noisy. (They say the walls are thin; this wasn't a problem for us. I guess you might be taking a chance...) Otherwise: nice place. Try it out!

Reviews.Title: “Fair performer”
Reviews.Author: Boxing_Kangaroo
Reviews.Content: The Cadillac Hotel succeeded in providing reasonably priced acceptable accommodation. Other than some spots or wear holes on the carpet the room was clean as was the rest of the building, the bed was comfortable although the pillows were thin (luckily I was alone and could pile both on top of each other), and the shower and bathroom were decent, with room service restocking and changing towels, etc each day. The wireless internet was quite good, and the counter staff were helpful, especially the bearded gentleman, and they try their best to give you a good room. You can also go up to the rooftop for good views, etc, but there's nothing really provided up there to make it comfortable other than a couple of broken chairs. On the negative side the Venice area is not really the most salubrious around these days. A lot of homeless people live just outside the hotel, along the beach front, and other unsavoury sorts can tend to gather around. Although I never really felt threatened, I also didn't feel entirely comfortable walking around at night. It is however just a few blocks north until you hit Santa Monica and the vibe improves quickly. A lot of peddlers and legal marijuana sales are also just out along the boardwalk - fine if that's what you're after. Also the area is quite noisy until around 11pm - midnight (this was during midweek). Another minor beef was that the coffee machine in the foyer was broken down for the three days I was there until the morning I was leaving - annoying that they didn't even provide alternative facilities, such as instant coffee to fill in. With no airconditioning, I also imagine it could get very hot in summer. Venice is also not that convenient to the main tourist areas, such as Hollywood, Downtown LA, or the theme parks. It's fine if you want a beach experience, but there's a fair bit of travelling to get anywhere else. Even Santa Monica is a decent half-hour walk away. It is possible to get the local bus to downtown, which takes about an hour and travels through some interesting areas that I was probably glad not to be walking through, but it is cheap at only $1.50. This bus goes quite close to the hotel and terminates at Union Station downtown. All up the Cadillac was a decent performer at a reasonable price for LA. In future I would probably stay elsewhere, say Santa Monica if I wanted the beach, or otherwise nearer to where the other action is, but that's probably as a much a statement about the area in general as the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “thin walls, very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Charles F
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was great, however the walls are super-thin, leading to a very noisy hotel experience. I was kept up late every night there due to the noise level both inside and outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: guggles
Reviews.Content: my friend and I just spent 2 nights at the Cadillac Hotel in Venice beach. We were referred by my daughter, and she advised that it was a quaint hotel in a very neat part of Los Angeles. My 65 year old friend and myself were delighted with the hotel. It was spotless. Lovely linens, brand new bathroom, nicely painted room. Wonderful lobby with fresh coffee, 2 computers to check emails, and couches to relax on. The staff was extreamly helpful with directions etc. Yes, the homeless came out after dark, but we all knew about it. We will go back again for sure. Gail Morrison Terrace, BC

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: bluestreak5
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for two nights (Th-F) near the end of February 2012, and we definitely got our money's worth. We paid a few bucks extra for an ocean view room, which looked right out over the beach. Many other hotels in LA would charge $400+/night for that kind of view, and we got it for less than $200/night. The room was clean and the staff was friendly. If you don't want to spend the money for the ocean view room, they have a rooftop patio with good views, although there weren't any chairs or furniture up there. The hotel had no breakfast either, but it is near several good cafes and breakfast/brunch places. The hotel is right on the boardwalk in Venice Beach, with all of its colorful characters. If you are from a rural area, it may seem a little intimidating. However, if you live in an urban area, you will feel right at home in this neighborhood. The only downside was that everything closed early. The boardwalk was relatively deserted after dark, and even the local bars were shooing us out by 11. (Maybe things stay open later in the summer?) Parking was an adventure. When we arrived, the man at the front desk told us that their lot was full, but we could park in the "public lot" a half-block away. (The hotel charges $15/night for the parking, even in this other lot.) We drove around looking for the lot, could not find it and had to go back and ask him which lot he meant. Eventually, we realized the lot he was referring to was not a public lot at all, but the valet lot for a local restaurant. This caused us some confusion and concern at first, but the valet said it was fine because they have an arrangement with the hotel. This was actually a great solution for us because it was a half-block from the hotel, and we had someone keeping an eye on our car. Bottom line: if you are looking for a four-star experience, spend the extra money to stay in Santa Monica or some other part of LA. However, if you want a decent room and view at half the price in an eclectic neighborhood, the Cadillac is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for in CALI”
Reviews.Author: tatertot1982
Reviews.Content: This place is AWESOME!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! If you love the simple things in life and are not a high maintenance snob, than this is the place for you. A walk down the sidewalk ...in 5 minutes your feet are in the sand. The views, the breeze with the windows in your room.....going out to the fire escape the smoke a legal doobie. The roof has a few tables, chairs and amazing!!!! views....I love this place because it is home away from home. I have "board meetings" in the ocean when I go there, and have a great working vacation. The staff is friendly and always remember ( after several years, wont stay anywhere else) The room is small and the bathroom is tiny, so you better like who you stay with alot. LOL. Charlie Chaplin used to have an apartment there and you can rent that room out....its very cool. the boardwalk and bike paths are great, you can rent a bike next door for $20 and the best cafe is a short walk on the left. My thinking is your probably not going to move your car so who cares about parking, once you park, don't move. And the room, if your smart you wont be in it long....THIS PLACE IS A TREASURE.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: DeeToz
Reviews.Content: When the bus tour I had booked messed up my booking and left me standing at the Cadillac Hotel with nowhere to go, Lindsay, the hotel front desk manager, went direct to the bus company who offered a refund. BUT I had a whole day to fill before my flight home and I was terribly disappointed. Jeff, the hotel manager, very kindly, personally drove me to the main bus tour depot in his own car, so I could connect with the tour along the route. I was amazed at his kindness and professionalism. Lindsay and Jeff, thank you both so much. The tour was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay in the midst of the hum-drum at venice beach”
Reviews.Author: michael s
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights and loved it. the entrance of the hotel is on the side in a small street - don't worry if your navigator gets you to the backstreet of this one, there is simply no other access by car. service and management was utterly friendly and forthcoming. looking out from a seafront view room, you'll get everything you came for to venice beach: sea breeze, waves, palm trees, the broadwalk with tons of artist stands and during the night, the homeless that are sleeping at the side of the hotel (totally acceptable by venice beach standards, they won't hazzle you and the noise was bearable at all times;-) everything in venice beach is in walking distance from the hotel - it's 20 minutes to santa monica pier and 30 to venice beach pier, in between is all the attractions, shops, cafes, restaurant you'd like for your visit. all things considered, the hotel is a great value for its location and atmosphere... well maintained for its age and a wonderful hangout if you want to have venice from its most original side.

Reviews.Title: “Floating Above the Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: Chris W
Reviews.Content: After grinding through LA's abusive roadways for a day, my wife and I decided we would bed down somewhere in the Santa Monica-Venice Beach-Marina del Rey string of neighborhoods. The Cadillac Hotel is right on the Venice Beach Boardwalk, and since it matched our budget--$80-$120 per night--we decided to try it. The unassuming building blends in seamlessly with the surrounding shops and residences, and the carnival of boardwalk characters who make Venice so famous were just bopping around every which way. However, once inside the hotel, we were impressed by how set apart the interior was from the boardwalk scene. From the lobby, through the halls, and to our room, it was clear the hotel had been recently renovated. With a minimalist approach, it was clean and stylish through and through, with no no air of hipster or This Is Art. The concierge on-duty appeared to be a one-man show for the evening. He was friendly, laid-back, and knowledgeable. For an additional $16 we were able to park just on the other side of building. We also requested wifi access for an extra $2. All tolled, we spent $140 for the night. Our queen room was a little gem, a comfy and close space. It had a simple elegance and the basic furnishing, which included a flat screen TV and ipod dock. Our window alone allowed us all the sights and sounds that, put together, make Venice Beach feel like SOMEWHERE--ocean waves rolling; people talking, singing, yelling, laughing; sand and palm trees all the way up to the lights of Santa Monica Pier. I can't imagine a better retreat in the grimy beauty that is LA.

Reviews.Title: “From the Sublime to the ridiculous”
Reviews.Author: suemap
Reviews.Content: The street people of Venice are a large part of what makes this community interesting. While it was slightly shocking to see a rather unsavory-looking group hanging out in front of the hotel -- we had just left the Getty Center (a lovely place with no blade of grass out of place) -- Moses, the night clerk, assured us they were artists who had no interest in harming their potential customers. We adjusted our attitude to enjoy the adventure, and we did indeed. The little grocery across the street had what we needed, though doesn't sell liquor of any kind; the corner cafe (Candles) was friendly and had a good menu at the right price. The fancy restaurant (Picolo) between the two was a snooty, overpriced joke we decided to skip. The neighborhood bar around the corner had live music: we danced. The bike 'n board shop a block away rented us 2 good bikes for a day of fun. What more could you want? Cadillac Hotel has simple, but eclectic decor and a great rooftop. Sheets were a bit thin, but the towels were plentiful, thick and fluffy. Clean room, good bed, friendly staff. Great location right on the Venice Beach/Boardwalk. I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Worth paying more elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: mwa4u
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Cadillac several years before, and heard that they had renovated since our last stay. I couldn't really see the improvement on the queen room we stayed in. There were stains on the carpets, the window didn't work properly, and the bathroom wasn't very nice. Also, I have to echo the comments I have read by others on TA - the area just isn't that nice. In summer/peak season I'm sure it isn't as bad, but in November it was deserted on weekdays except for loud homeless people who heckled you occasionally when you walked past. It didn't bother us too much since we're used to cities, but at night the area was quite seedy and felt quite unsafe, and we wished we had paid more and stayed somewhere else! Also, it was noisy at night (from other guests in the hotel, and the street outside). The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay great price!!!”
Reviews.Author: tannermg
Reviews.Content: Location was amazing, and for 400 for 3 nights you cant beat that, roof access was awesome to see the beach, staff was really friendly and rooms were clean and neat! Sure there was some stains on the floor but who cares the beds were comfy the atmosphere was great and we are excited to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Zoe T
Reviews.Content: Had pretty low expectations when booking this hotel but my room was great! It was nice and spacious and I had a beautiful view of the beach from my window. The guys at the desk were super helpful booking me a tour and telling me all the good places to go. I will definitely be back!! From 'the hot chick' HAHA xx

Reviews.Title: “Very bad place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dfler
Reviews.Content: Very uncomfortable room, bad service, dirty, unsafe, Ripoff parking fee when you can park in the public lot next to the beach a lot cheaper. Overpriced. The room is very plain with a horrible excuse of a bed. even the homeless all around the place wouldn't stay in one of these rooms.

Reviews.Title: “No More Cadillac Hotel for me!”
Reviews.Author: SanAntonian1
Reviews.Content: You can see the ocean from some of the rooms! That's only positive to this facility that I saw. Its an old hotel which has undergone a few upgrade, not nearly enough. No air conditioning=no way to maintain a reasonable constant temperature, much less a comfortable temperature. The bathroom had upgraded fixtures but no space to appreciate them. A person of height could not even sit on the toilet without knees being against the shower wall. The shower was a tight fit for a small person. Outside: the parking was limited and terrible and that at an extra $15 per night! The "appeal" of the facility is the beach frontage. That's ok if you want the deco businesses to close as soon as darkness comes. Even more distracting are the numerous homeless persons sleeping there in their make-shift tents or on park benches. Add further the all too frequent wail of sirens of ambulances and police coming into the area to remove those affected by overdose of drugs. All in all -- I would much rather have a comfortable, modern hotel even if a short drive is required to reach Venice Beach. Such are available and at a much lower price than the Cadillac Hotel. No more Cadillac Hotel for me!

Reviews.Title: “Yes, Thanks Cadillac !”
Reviews.Author: Lorenzo D
Reviews.Content: Of course the parking is sometimes crowded but there is always a solution and the personnel is very helpful. Other than that, you will be right by The Strand and the sand that lead to the Ocean. The location is at the Heart of Venice Beach, you will have contact with Artists. The night life ends early 11 pm but you have Main Street a few blocks away walking distance for music or else. The Hotel is very nice and well kept, the team always helpful. The quality of the beds is just perfect, The location is also quite good to discover L.A. and Southern California. The Hotel and neighbourhood can be a little intimidating at the beginning, but do not worry, you can relax and enjoy your stay, you will be in one of the most exciting place on Earth....Dudley Av. 8, Venice, CA 90291... Lorenzo from Switzerland

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever been to”
Reviews.Author: moomooloo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at many hotels and hostels worldwide. On our recent trip we booked into this hotel, described as art deco, boutique we thought we would try it....what a mistake. We have stayed at hostels for $20 which have been like palaces compared to this place. Firstly it was way overpriced $250 per night. Secondly, when we arrived there were junkies and homeless laying on the entrance strip, our children grabbed us and said they didnt feel safe and neither did we. (despite the fact we volunteer and contribute to our local homeless shelter) We go in, the front door is sticky, we go upstairs, the hotel lift barely fits all 4 of us, the hotels stinks of musty old smoke. the room is like a shoe box, with stains on the floor and bed spread, and the vents and airconditioning are literally coming off the wall. bathroom dirty.. The bar on the corner is blaring and we realise this is not for us. there is no way if we had of stayed would we have slept due to the noise. we did not feel comfortable with the thought of walking the streets to find dinner. Our excitement for this boutique hotel in santa monica soon changed. Both my daughter and eye were in tears, my husband furious so we left. The description for this hotel, or art deco and boutique and the rest is so misleading, although there is a nice view downstairs, our hotel room had a view of the tin roof, full of smokes, rubbish and waste. When we went downstairs and proceeded to explain to the receptionist we were leaving and wanted a refund and why she said it shouldnt be a problem as we didnt stay....we are yet to see a refund and although have contacted the hotel and booking site 4 times..hotels.com, we have not had a response. all i can say to you is think twice before booking here.

Reviews.Title: “great 2.5* boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: hoser9
Reviews.Content: This is in Venice Beach. Venice has various groups of people, from junkies to the homeless, to students, to starving artists, to loaded artists. If you're looking for typical fake LA and would be terrified by people of a lower social caste talking to you, then you're going to be mortified by the boardwalk and therefore, this hotel. You gotta take it in stride. The checkin dude was pretty alright, got us into our room pretty quick. The room was surprisingly nice. No AC, which wasn't an issue because it was a cold spring weekend on the beach. The fan cooled us down a lot. The room was pretty basic, the floor had a bit of a stain but we didn't lose sleep over that. The bathroom smelled like bleach which didn't offend us. Nice clear HDTV mounted on the wall: the room was small but made very good use of space. The location is awesome, right on the boardwalk. Again, it's Venice, not Malibu. A LAPD chopper about 1000ft above flew near the hotel for about 5 mins at 0330 on a wednesday. We found this amusing. The police in the USA do not f--- around apparently. Venice doesn't have many bars, so if you wanna drink some margs and people watch, bring your own. lolz. Parking was pricy, so, yes, we parked on the street about 10 min walk away. Well worth the money saved. Value is, meh. It's hard to get a cheap room in such a good location, so we were accepting of the price. We were not a fan of the $4/day "tech fee". WTF. This is a cool hotel in a cool location, the people who gave negative reviews seem to be those who had no idea what Venice would entail.

Reviews.Title: “European style”
Reviews.Author: CalArtGal
Reviews.Content: Friendly front desk, clean room, comfy bed, nice towels and very close to the beach. I had a room with a Pacific Ocean view (if I looked out at an angle). The roof top for sunsets is a must and be prepared for the wind up there. Ask for where the locals go to eat for more reasonable pricing -- you'll have to drive there or be prepared for a good walk. I'll be going back and staying longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: FreeFi
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Cadillac Hotel in Dec 2010. We arrived early Christmas Day morning and had organised with the hotel prior to leaving Australia for our room to be ready. The hotel was very accommodating. We were worried that after a long flight from Australia we would have to wait around on Venice Beach on Christmas morning but the hotel went out of there way to ensure we could have our room to access. Our room had a great view, that I am sure we hadn't booked, or was just way better then what we had anticipated which was a lovely little surprise for us on Christmas day :) All the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. They gave us some great tips on how to get the most out of our time in Venice. Some noise from cleaners and a little street noise but nothing too disturbing. Street noise in Venice is kinda part of the fun of the place. If you are not looking for that atmosphere perhaps Santa Monica is more your style. But we loved the place, great location. We would defiantly stay here again and would recommend to anyone wanting a great hotel, in great location with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Brooke G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our short stay at the Cadillac hotel. For us it was perfectly located for our plans. We arrived around 7 pm and were initially concerned on arrival to our room, as there was very loud music being played nearby, We inquired about the noise and found it was from the shop located at the front ground level of the building. The noise soon stopped and did not start again 'til late the next morning, so was of no concern to us. The staff were friendly and helpful and the room was clean and comfortable - we had no views and the room was quite dark but that didn't really bother us. We had dinner about 10 min walk away, over in Santa Monica. We walked back to the hotel around midnight along the boardwalk and felt safe enough. The following day we enjoyed exploring the immediate surroundings of the hotel. It's fun and quirky and has a great vibe. We just wish we had longer to explore the place. We would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean updated budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: HightechLowlife
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean and newly renovated. Hallways are a bit shabby. Sound insulation could be better but location is great for people watching

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly staff - just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: Claire B
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time at the Cadillac. We were on the top floor in a corner room with a double aspect window and ocean views. Perfect location for chilling out in Venice Beach and Santa Monica. Rooms basic but clean and of a perfectly adequate size and beds were comfortable. No air conditioning but with the windows open and fan on this was not a problem. Coffee day and night in the lobby was a nice additional perk. Staff were very friendly and helpful e.g. faulty i pod doc was replaced immediately. Yes, we had to pay for parking but at $15 dollars a night this was reasonable given the location. Would definitely go back, in fact wish we were there now.

Reviews.Title: “you do not get what you see”
Reviews.Author: missritz_11
Reviews.Content: Break down they repainted... got new beds and remodeled the bathrooms. There is no air conditioning just a ceiling fan. The beds are not the most comfortable, other than the higher than life blonde girl at the front desk the customer service sucks. The parking IS 15 dollars in an alley over that reeks of pee and they charge you 3.00 a night for wireless. The "beach" cafes near by had horrible food but the bar (venice bistro) was decent. Homeless are everywhere but dont bother you much however it IS beach front really close to main street that has a ton of cool cafes, restaurants and bars and 5 mins from Santa Monica. Decide for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “We Have stayed at this hotel many times and we will be back many more times”
Reviews.Author: slsonya
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel with great customer service the people at the front desk were very friendly and helpful and we loved the starbucks coffee machine in the lobby. The Hotel is in a perfect location right on the boardwalk steps from the sand. The rooms are clean and comfortable we love the big showers and being able to open our windows and feel the ocean breeze. It was a great trip and we will for sure be back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, funky/roomy/spartan rooms, but expect noise/homeless”
Reviews.Author: JonBird
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were quite pleased with this hotel as were two of the other three couples we travelled with. We were all on the beach side of the hotel with direct views of the water and boardwalk. Downside for the dissenting couple was they were on second floor which was noisier. Lack of AC means you need to leave windows open for ventilation but noise and perceived safety issues from the partiers an nearby club and homeless may bother those unaware or sensitive to nightime noise. If you can live with that, I can't imagine a better location. Directly on the boardwalk, with everything you need in walking distance. We'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, clean and very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Mojolifestyle
Reviews.Content: We, my husband and I, visited The Cadillac Hotel July 3-8, 2011. Since we had visited the area before, we knew that the location was perfect for our purposes (visiting some of the great yoga studios in Main St and relax on the beach). We had a lovely room (404) with part view of the ocean/beach, and although it can be noisy at night, it never disturbed us. The rooms are standard European size, well cleaned with a nice bathroom. We also appreciated having fast wifi in our room for only $3/day. The Cadillac Hotel is close to everything, great breakfasts (The Figtree, Rose, etc) and casual dining in Main St, as well as great shopping and more formal dining in Santa Monica. We were super impressed with the helpfulness of the staff, in particular Jeff, who helped us out with a very unpleasant experience we had with a rental car company. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and clean”
Reviews.Author: citrus_pounch
Reviews.Content: Overall, my wife and I enjoyed our stay at the Cadillac Hotel. The room, as well as the overall decor, was very simple and clean, although not very spacious which is expected given the location. The lack of paintings on the walls and simplicity could make the room look gloomy to others, especially with the view we had (....a red-bricked wall!) But not to me; the flat screen was a nice addition! There is a store under the hotel and a restaurant right across, so it can get a little loud. We found the beds to be very comfortable and slept like babies. The front desk was friendly and helpful. There is a free coffee/tea/chocolate in the lobby, and a pool table available for guests to use. I read other reviews complaining about the homeless people in front of the hotel. Those reviews are true but I have never felt unsafe or anything. If that ticks you off, you should probably stay away from Venice Beach overall... Parking is $15 overnight and spaces are very small. I would definitely consider this hotel for my next trip in the area.

Reviews.Title: “casual clean and friendly in the beach”
Reviews.Author: HanoiFamily
Reviews.Content: Bright new rooms in a vintage building, friendly young desk staff and the ocean side. Top it off with the weird, the Hot and the Pitiful in the boardwalk and you won't need the big plasma TV in the rooms. Not cheap but good value. Thanks, Cadillac

Reviews.Title: “Close to beach, a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: NMcPhillips
Reviews.Content: Well located right on the beach. Clean room. Internet $3. Their car park was full every night so we had to park in the overflow car park at $15 a night. There was some noise from the homeless people that seemed to congregate in front of the hotel. Overall experience was positive, would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: brazilianmomma
Reviews.Content: The location of the Cadillac Hotel is excellent. The price was very reasonable. It's centrally located and we were able to walk safely everywhere. Our room was outstanding. It was clean, large and had a great view of the ocean. The beds were comfortable and inviting. The staff at the hotel was incredible! They always welcomed us with a big smile and were most helpful in giving suggestions and directions to sites we were interested in seeing. We will definitely return to the area and will always stay at this hotel. You must try this hotel. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Very cool!”
Reviews.Author: Ivy67
Reviews.Content: This is an old 1914 hotel that has been refurbished. Very interesting and simple art-deco theme. Sort of Bohemian/Hostel type feel. It is nothing fancy, but we thought it was super-cool and fun to be right on the boardwalk. The rooms are very clean -- the bathrooms were especially squeaky-clean, and when we had a problem with the bathroom sink draining slow, they got someone up there in minutes to fix the problem. The rooftop patio was fun in the evening we met some great people up there every night -- from Australia, Ireland, and all over the U.S. If you are looking for a chain hotel atmosphere like Hampton Inn or Fairfield Inn, this is definitely not for you. This is much more hip and fun.

Reviews.Title: “It's a nice hotel. It's Venice Beach!”
Reviews.Author: Pizmopete
Reviews.Content: It is right on the beach! They have free Starbucks coffee. The rooms are really nice with ceiling fans and the bathrooms are clean and new. It was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wafer thin walls and very noisy and smelly.”
Reviews.Author: janpanuk
Reviews.Content: I cant really think of many good things to say about this place, its close to the beach and that's about it. The rooms though freshly painted feel gloomy and the walls are wafer thin. Peoples telly's blaring till 5am and the resident crack heads shouting all night outside the windows. Its not the worse place I've ever stayed but I certainly would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Too bad about the crackheads.”
Reviews.Author: spbjerg
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a boutique feel. Rooms are renovated - but with quirks; no screens, no aircon etc. Which was fine by me. Open window and a fan works fine. Hotel parking and fine overall service. The problem is, that the hotel seems to be placed in the middle of a huge (30-50 persons) campsite for the homeless. I understand that these people are a part of the Venice experience, but when they start shouting "fxxx you, motherfxxxxxx" for hours at each other at 6am and go on screaming and shouting all through the day, it becomes a really bad experience. Colorful: fine. Insane screaming crackheads: not so much. Get that cleaned up - and this hotel is in business!

Reviews.Title: “Unsuspecting gem in the middle of Venice Beach”
Reviews.Author: YVRIRL
Reviews.Content: This refurbished small hotel is simple and clean with standard sized double beds and a feel of a boutique hotel. It is right in the middle of Venice Beach making it a very convenient location for those who have choosen to come to seek the sun on this infamous stretch of LA beach. This area is lively and the eateries are right in front of the hotel. It is not a place for families with young children as the area outside the hotel is the a place of rest for many of the denizens of Venice Beach at night. The hotel parking is limited.

Reviews.Title: “that is the right place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MissBulgaria
Reviews.Content: I was on a road trip around US and I’ve got in Venice beach so I needed a place to stay for two days. Suddenly I’ve got into Cadillac hotel which is just on the front walk.I was pleasantly surprised to find out that they were extremely kind and found me the room I needed in a very good price. All of the people who are working there are very helpful with everything you need from a market to some place to go at night. I really liked the room service and the location. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Service”
Reviews.Author: mlaessig2
Reviews.Content: The Cadillac was a great value. Fantastic location right off the beach and boardwalk, but was surprisingly quiet at night. Very clean comfortable rooms obviously recently remodeled. Very helpful and knowledgeable front desk staff that made some great recommendations for things we asked about (most notably food). Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “An Outstanding Hidden Gem...pleasently surprised”
Reviews.Author: alphamonx
Reviews.Content: Im big on the low expectation equals surprise and blessings thing. OK, first, if you plan on visiting VENICE BEACH as a destination resort, good luck with that... Venice beach is Venice beach.. this is a great find for anyone who wants to enjoy LA.. I stayed on a Sunday, and had a very important meeting Monday in Santa Monica, I didn't want to risk travel time, so it was time for yelp... I thought it was interesting the conflicting reviews... then noted who and where they were from... again, I can not stress enough... VENICE is urban meets Bohemian... Santa Monica was crazy expensive to just crash, figured for under 150, cant lose.. MAN AM I GLAD I DID. The staff, were great, Linzy, Chris and Kenn, all cool people. the room was fresh, iphone dock, fridge, really nice bathroom. KILLER ROOF TOP, kicked it and smoked, enjoyed watching the people watching. rooms are nice cause no Formica peeling, etc.. here's the bang for the buck part... the tech fee is 3 bucks its added to all rooms, but, yo, YOOOOO!!! um, they have 2 nice PC workstations loaded with your favorite programs etc, but the BEST is PRINT FOR FREE.. gawd, that saved me so much headache, yeah there was free wifi, but i would have had to travel and find a copy spot, always expensive. oh and free Starbucks coffee... FTW... man i checked out early, and the staff were friendly enough to let me stop and use restroom on way back out of town a few hours later. Most places in the area you'll find are not that courteous, nor are most PUBLIC RESTROOMS in the area a place I'd even enter.. this hotel is very well maintained, and the amenities and public areas are equally cared for. for the $, no better find, I will be back, JUST TO KICK IT.. that dope. ps... IF YOU WALK ON ANY HOTEL FLOOR BAREFOOTED YOU ARE THE GROSS ONE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: daiseypoppy
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean rooms, Great friendly Staff and couldn't get a better location walk out the front door on to the Venice Beach Boardwalk

Reviews.Title: “The Cadillac is a Gem in the rough”
Reviews.Author: kankauckland
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank "you" for the wonderful stay at your Hotel-I cant remember the name of the beautiful blond receptionist, but she totally made our experience exceptional by recommending great cafe's to eat at and placing us in a great room, my exgirlfriend and I hadn't seen each other in a couple of years , so the stay at your Hotel and in LA, made for a great get together again even though we went our separate ways after. anyway thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: London_E14
Reviews.Content: I was concerned about the parking having read previous reviews however the current situation is much improved. There are now 12 car spaces (not 4) costing US$15 per day - one space per 3 or 4 hotel rooms. The hotel does not sell more than 12 space vouchers per day and helped me regain my space promptly after someone else had parked there. It was tricky to find the hotel by car. You need to take Rose Ave to its end at the beach and drive down the small alley on the left just before the beach. The car park is on the right directly after the hotel building. There are sufficient parking spaces within a few minutes walk but you do have to look for them - they have restrictions but it was mostly on Tuesdays and Wednesdays for street cleaning. Wifi in rooms and PCs at reception available for compulsory charge of about US$4. Most guests were couples and 30-something Europeans. No air conditioning but I didnt find this a problem as evening are cool being directly on the beach. There are quite a number of homeless people in the Venice & Santa Monica area.

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: NE_Wayfarer
Reviews.Content: Well, it IS close to the Venice Beach boardwalk. Had several small, annoying problems with my stay. 1) Room wasn't ready when I arrived (after 3PM), had to wait an hour. 2) Was told that the parking lot wasn't available for 4 hours because somebody was filming a movie there. 3) Was told that it was $15 to park overnight until noon, but if I stayed in the lot beyond noon, it was an additional $5. Parking lot actually charged me $10; hotel staff basically said, oh, well, I guess we misinformed you. I'm not going to make a big deal about $5, but that just kind of sums up my experience. 4) Room had no A/C and no window screen. If you looked straight out the window, you could see the ocean; if you looked down a bit, you could see a roof covered with pigeon presents. 5) When I booked the hotel it was supposed to be $109/night; I think they charged me $112, but by that point I had just given up. This is your basic 'you-get-what-you-pay-for' place. It was clean, absolutely no-frills. If you need to be on the boardwalk and just need a place to sleep, I guess this fits the bill. The Venice Beach boardwalk itself was a disappointment. I was expecting more of an artistic, creative experience (and maybe it IS like that on weekends), but it was more like a bunch of hobos selling crap, people who couldn't play their instruments, and teenage ne'er-do-wells affecting a homeless, hipsterish persona (at least until daddy stops paying the bill).

Reviews.Title: “Check out the waves from your bedroom window.”
Reviews.Author: sistersuz
Reviews.Content: One 18 y/o marine from Minnesota with his aunt and uncle. One night before shipping out overseas. Where to go? Venice-of course! Reserved our room (#201) the night before over the internet. Check in quick, courteous & helpful. Took the tight-squeeze lift to our room which opened up to a small sitting room with a desk, sofa-bed, flat screen TV and kitchenette. Carpet was a bit grungy but held up well to flip flops. Closable door led to the funky bedroom and updated bath. Happy to have reading lamps on BOTH sides of bed and a fan/light overhead. Husband thrilled to have flatscreen TV in bedroom. Windows in sitting and bedroom had excellent views of the boardwalk right through to the surf. The lobby had a pooltable and 2 ($3 automatic-fee) computers. Parking in nearby lot was $15 with in & out use. We parked one car in the lot and had to park the other about 1/2 mile away as we were being cheap. We would absolutely stay here again. Not a place I'd bring my mother to but for front row seats to all that is Venice-this can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location providing good value for money”
Reviews.Author: robert190793
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the Cadillac & was delighted with the overall experience. The hotel is in a fantastic location on Venice Beach and is easily accessible. The staff we met were all friendly & very helpful when needed assistance in respect of directions etc. As well as being on the beach itself the hotel was only five minutes walk away from Main Street (with a lot of good pubs), and 15-20 minutes walk from both Venice and Santa Monica piers. The rooms themselves are basic but clean and the servicing of these is very good. Whilst there are undoubtedly much nicer and more upmarket hotels in the area the Cadillac offers very good value for money and I would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and staff”
Reviews.Author: UKkiwiLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: The Cadillac hotel is in a perfect location on Venice beach and a short drive from LAX. We arrived late and made the most of the beach location in the morning for a good walk. The rooms are nicely renovated an clean. The friendly and professional front desk staff are the real highlight of this hotel though. They recommended a really good place for breakfast (the fig tree cafe just around the corner) and then helped us out when we had problems with our rental car. Better service than hotels 3 times the price. A real gem.

Reviews.Title: “pefect”
Reviews.Author: LettuceMunich
Reviews.Content: this hotel was wonderfull. price and perfomance was perfect. a had a suite with own kitchen and view to the beach...you should do this....

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: Emelie75
Reviews.Content: The Cadillac is situated just by the beach which is nice. However, arriving in the late evening with young kids or strolling out in the earlier part of the morning, the location is too far "to the right" on the beach to feel quite safe. During day time it's great though. The staff wasn't very friendly and the room was moderately clean. We appreciated the bathroom with a big nice shower and also the fridge in the room. Beds were comfy enough and we could listen to the ocean, which was great. For the price, it's a good short time (we only stayed one night) stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location right on Venice Beach”
Reviews.Author: ExperienceKenya
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Cadillac whilst working in LA - it's a great location at the end of the day when you've been working as it is pretty much on the beach. One thing I wasn't aware of is just how diverse Venice Beach is - right outside the hotel you've got a few homeless people, though they were very friendly and non-threatening, and then right opposite the hotel there is a super expensive gourmet restaurant (absolutely excellent food by the way!). Great running, walking and cycling up and down the beach, and the hotel itself is simple but clean, and excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, simple, fresh and new”
Reviews.Author: smileymadsen
Reviews.Content: Good value for the money - I would definately stay there again. Great location - right at the beach. The room was very simple, uncluttered, fresh and the bathroom was all new. Nice eco-friendly toiletries. There was a $3/day "tech fee" for all guests, but then there was 24/7 web access in the lobby (I think wireless access in the rooms too - I was travelling without my laptop). The staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful. My bags were delayed, and actually arrived AFTER I had left the hotel - they called to the airline to let them know I'd already gone, and the bags were still sitting at their hotel. There was a small mini-mart across the street that also served some hot food, which was handy. Parking was also available, not sure of the cost though.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly What It Should BE”
Reviews.Author: OBX_Innkeeper
Reviews.Content: The Cadillac Hotel is exactly what it represents itself to be; a cool, eclectic, affordable hotel right on the Pacific in Venice Beach. If you're looking for the Ramada, stay there. If you're looking for an affordable, quirky, cool little place with good service, attentive staff (Moses is the BOMB), and great views right in the heart of quirky, cool Venice Beach, you will be very pleased. We were, and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Inexpensive Getaway...”
Reviews.Author: RBobele
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute trip for us and we’re glad we stayed at this hotel. As frequent visitors to the Venice Beach Boardwalk, we wanted to try one of the ones on the boardwalk and the ocean view room was the best! For the price, atmosphere and quality of the new remodeled rooms, what else would you want? We’re already talking about staying at the Cadillac again in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute garbage”
Reviews.Author: rosser2227
Reviews.Content: This hotel is complete garbage, Staff were not friendly or helpfull, my room was not ready even after i had organised an early check-inn prior to my stay. The toilet in my room did not work nor did the A/C nor did the phone. I paid $180US for an ocean view room and i can tell you honestly its more like a $50 a night hotel. I would not recommend this place at all.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Art Gallery in lobby!”
Reviews.Author: MizAdvisor
Reviews.Content: I love the Art Gallery in the lobby! Great place, to pick up something beautiful! I did! The gallery is run by http://www.mirror-space.com/ The hotel is quite charming, and for the money the location cannot be beat! Steps from the ocean and so many interesting things to see and do!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: AndreaFisher
Reviews.Content: My needs are fairly basic (somewhere to sleep that is clean, close to everything, has a comfy bed, and is not too expensive) and it met all my needs perfectly. I stayed here for one night, and would certainly come back, and recommend it to my friends. As well as the above, it is right on Venice Beach; and the lobby has guest computers, a television, and several books. And the staff are really friendly and helpful! I had a number of questions before and during my stay (including after I had checked out) and they could not have been more friendly & welcoming. I love the whole Venice atmosphere: the shops, the passing parade, Santa Monica pier, the lovely houses along the canals, strolling along the beach with an ice-cream, it was all a lot of fun. I would just be a bit more careful of my surroundings at night. BTW, if your taxi driver's GPS says you have arrived, but he is not sure where it is … you are probably there: the sign is mounted quite high on the wall

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Excellent Value - Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: energise_ross
Reviews.Content: Now, Venice Beach is not for everyone. I wouldn't come here with my family, and I wouldn't come here for romance, but it is edgy, weird, colourful etc. and I love it for that. And if you want Venice, you want the beach then you literally CANNOT beat the Cadillac. It is perfect for this. The staff are very friendly, the rooms are all renovated and very comfortable and the location is spot on. You're 20 mins walk or a $1/ 5 min cab ride from Santa Monica and it seems like the sun always shines! The beds are comfortable and the bathrooms are decent enough and are all newly renovated. The only downsides I can think of are: - no breakfast, but the Fig Tree less than a block away does amazing breakfasts and is half price between 8 and 9 - no bath, but really, who HAS to have a bath - noise from outside. It was a bit noisy outside, but often hilarious noise from randoms. I didn't have any trouble getting to sleep in the slightest though, and I was here on Thurs, Fri and Sat night and in bed pretty early for a weekend. If you want to stay in Venice I truly recommend this hotel. It really is right on the beach, and right at the north end of the Venice boardwalk. Ross Oh, and while it is definitely a no-frills rooftop, head up there for the view and to chill in the sun.

Reviews.Title: “We were not disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Cowdeo
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Cadillac Hotel on the last night of our Los Angeles trip. We wanted to be near the beach at a reasonable price. When we checked in we learned that we had been upgraded to a suite at no additional cost. The rooms were clean (except for a wet spot from an apparent coffee spill on the floor) and even the large windows with a view to the ocean were nearly spotless. You could even see the ocean from the bathroom! The decor was simple and tasteful - it felt somewhat European I thought. Nice bathroom, comfortable, clean bed, and a kitchen, two flat-screen TVs. We enjoyed the Bohemian atmosphere and folks on the Venice Beach Boardwalk. But the desk clerk at the hotel made our check-in not only efficient, but fun. He was a great guy, and we felt like good friends after a few enjoyable chats with him. We would stay at this hotel again without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: JasminTaylor
Reviews.Content: A really great hotel, the rooftop view is amazing. They could probably do with an extra chair or two up there but the view is just crazy. Room was clean and comfortable, could see Venice Beach from my bed- yay!! So cool to wake up to that view.. The only bad thing was the smell of pot that wafted through the window but that was nothing to do with the hotel- that's just Venice baby!! Ha!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great staff, bad area”
Reviews.Author: Jessie7707
Reviews.Content: We booked 5 nights at this hotel. The rooms are small, but nice with comfortable beds. The cleaning was poor, dirty under the beds and along the edges around the room. We arrived during daytime, and when the evening came we discovered that there was a lot of homeless and people doing drugs. They didn´t approach us unless you were smoking, but it felt very unsafe. We were afraid to go anywhere else but to the restaurang across the street! Our first night in the hotel, we felt marijuana smoke in the hallway.. Nothing to do during the evening, only two or three restaurants close to the hotel. A few more close to Rose Avenue about 5 min walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you like the area”
Reviews.Author: Sarahk1986
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to read the bad reviews below because my experience of the hotel was great. We stayed here for one night on our drive down the coast. We had planned to stay in Santa Monica but hadn't booked anywhere and driving round LA was such a nightmare we parked up near Venice Beach and luckily found this hotel which was mentioned in our guide book. Ok, so Venice Beach as an area isn't for everyone, but I loved that sort of atmosphere. On the beach front there were a lot of homeless and people probably on drugs (there were 3 medical marajuana centres) so I wouldn't advise it for those with children, but I felt perfectly safe even at night. The people weren't nearly at threatening or scary as some of the beggars in the big cities (San Fran/ San Diego). Just a couple of blocks into the town from the hotel are loads of good restaurants. As for the hotel, all staff we spoke to were very friendly. The first receptionist advised us the best place to park; an underground parking lot just a couple of blocks away which was $12 for overnight and seemed safest. He provided a map and showed us how to get there and where to go for dinner. Other guys were also friendly and chatty. The room was clean, no problems with it. The blind had fallen down but we put it back up ourselves easily. Hotel is just by the beach, great for a morning stroll. There was some noise from the beach but we didn't mind, we could hear a live band which was good to listen to.

Reviews.Title: “NOOOOO! DO NOT GO TO CADILLAC HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: shortcakefun
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY AT CADILLAC HOTEL if....you like to feel safe, want to sleep on a comfortable bed, want descent parking and pricing. After my daughter and I checked out after 20 minutes, we were charged the full price plus parking (which was double the parking price a block over). The parking was squeezed in between buildings and signs marked area as hotel not responsible for any damage or items missing. My husband is a federal employee and travels often. I was afraid to tell him about the Cadillac hotel that his girls were in. So,I drove up the coast about 1 mile and spent $20.00 more for a room that was lovely, very safe, had an ocean view, and was across from Santa Monica pier with FREE PARKING!!! The next morning, I drove back to Cadillac hotel to ask about my bill and they charged my card. They said they had to charge the full amount, which ended up being $189.00. They were not able to credit my account. This hotel was awful. Their actions were all about money, not customer service. Local California residents recommended to stay away from that area because drugs were very prevalent. I am thankful that I went to another hotel even though it cost twice as much for one night. Please....do not make the same mistake that I did.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this location on Venice beach”
Reviews.Author: Nina1976
Reviews.Content: We were originally looking to stay in Santa Monica but on our budget we opted for beachfront on Venice instead of back blocks of Santa Monica and were not disappointed The hotel is in a great spot and it's a quick bus ride up to Santa Monica or about an enjoyable 40 minute stroll along the boardwalk. There is a nice bar and eatery (Venice Ale house) right by the hotel. Yes there are some crazy folk about- but it's Venice Beach- and we (2 girls) never felt unsafe in the area. The hotel has everything you need - but could be hot without air conditioning in the height of summer. But it's biggest drawcard is being able to walk out onto the beach outside. Staff friendly and happy to help. Not the biggest rooms but adequate. Not the most amazing hotel in the area but for the price and location a good option especially for a stop over as airport is super close.

Reviews.Title: “just in the beach”
Reviews.Author: Kuna-khamu
Reviews.Content: The room was good. It is true that around the hotel there is a lot of homless people but they don't bother you and are quite cool. the hotel is just on the beach so it is very nice to cycle till Santa Monica and be away of all th L.A. traffic. Personal are very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: cjsulli
Reviews.Content: I read the other reviews on TripAdvisors and was fooled by the "great" location mantra. From my understanding this place used to be a hostel and it's definitely haunted by it's past. The rooms are very small and cleanliness is not the hotel's top priority (see pictures). It was so bad that I asked to be moved to another room but was told the hotel was full and I would have to try again in a few days. No such luck. Here are the highlights (or lowlights as it is more appropriately entitled): - Parking is ridiculously difficult; this is not the hotel's fault however, they charge for parking in their lot in which it is nearly impossible to get a spot. The one night I lucked out and got a spot, hotel charged me for two days of parking ($30) when I entered the lot at 11:30 p.m. and departed at 2:00 p.m. the next day. Unbelievable! The other option is to park on the street which is free but not easy. I ended up parking almost a mile away from the hotel. I know the distance because I had to use my car's GPS to find my way back to the hotel (embarrassing but true). - The rooms are not as advertised and there was no refrigerator which I really wanted and expected. - The rooms were not very clean or well kept (see pictures). - The walls are paper thin! You can hear your neighbors' thoughts! The hotel is also very loud which isn't a problem at 6:00 p.m. but it's annoying at 6:00 a.m. It's also supposed to be a non-smoking hotel which other guests continuously ignore that rule. When I contacted the front desk in reference to the smoke filled halls which was infiltrating my room. I was told that the only thing they could do was charge the guests for violating that rule! - The window was broken so it wouldn't stay open. I found this out the very hard way after it slammed down on my hand causing three injured fingers (including one with a bloodclot). - No cell phone reception in the hotel. This may just be my carrier but it was still very annoying. On the flip side, the hotel has reliable wi-fi service. - I want to speak briefly about its "great" location. This was my first visit to Venice Beach and though none of my friends had stayed at this hotel, the general area came highly recommended. I read the other reviews about the characters that hang out around the hotel but they were not explicit enough. Many of the people are from a half-way house located on the next street and are addicts and other unseemly types. I was warned by a local to be back inside the hotel by dark or no later than 9:00 pm and after my five-day stay I can say he was absolutely correct in giving this advice. One night the police had cordoned off the area around the hotel because a "man with a gun" was on the loose. There were many police cars and a helicopter. Even during the day I found the area undesirable...and I'm from New York City! If I were to return I would definitely stay further towards the Santa Monica Pier area. - The staff was the only reason I gave the hotel 2 stars. They weren't helpful per se but they were very friendly and nice even when not being of any true service.

Reviews.Title: “back again. wont stay anywhere else in venice beach.”
Reviews.Author: murph36
Reviews.Content: i came back here again after staying last year and its gotten even better then before. staff are great and the hotel reception areas been renovated since my last stay and looks great. rooms are still spotlessly clean but again wasnt in them for long, too busy outside on the beachfront. Cant recommend the cadillac hotel strongly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: SaraAlice
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on the Venice beach boardwalk and right on the beach - amazing location. The rooms have been renovated and are lovely and spacious. The front desk are really really helpful. Overall, great place to stay and it is affordable unlike most of LA.

Reviews.Title: “Stay on a Sunday for wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Vickyjo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in fact in Oct 2008. The hotel was fine, good location but the real experience is to get the corner room on a Sunday. Open the windows and enjoy the buzz from the market below. Absolutly fantastic! Apart from that this Hotel does it's job and is in a great location but can be a little intimidating at night in this area. I would say you're not going to stay in this hotel if you expect luxuary, it's more for the basic 20-30s crowd and for that it's great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: sparky2735
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the staff friendly and very helpful. Do not expect a suite, but you are right on the beach in Venice. The historic building is just that, but has been renovated. There is a large common area which is from a different era of hotels and very relaxing. The rooms are well kept and maintained. For staying at Venice Beach , this is an excellent choice. Do not expect a beach resort, this is a hotel. It is convenient to Santa Monica and bus connections to all of LA

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!! Highly recommended for the true Venice experience!!”
Reviews.Author: BrianCunningham
Reviews.Content: This hotel sits directly on the infamous Venice boardwalk. It's eclectic charm and vintage feel make it a must for those wanting to enjoy the full Venice experience!! The location is unbeatable, except that is, for the unsurpassed customer service. The manager, Jeff, treated us as though we were his personal guests... ensuring that our every need and expectation were met. The Cadillac Hotel is now my new home-away-from-home whenever I visit the SoCal area, and I will most certainly return next summer for another fabulous stay! I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!!! Simple and convenient”
Reviews.Author: costaricantrvlr
Reviews.Content: The Cadillac Hotel was the perfect spot for our girls vacation. Every single person we enountered was so accommodating and pleasant to talk to..Everyone was willing to help you make plans and suggested great activities and places to eat..thank you Nikky!!! Our room was clean and had everything we needed. The location was excellent!! The area around the hotel is safe and right by the beach.. We loved it!! definitely will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but noisy!”
Reviews.Author: lisalashes7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights over the May bank holiday. Hard hotel to find as you have to go round alot of one way back streets to get to it! We pulled up outside and asked at reception about parking - there was no space so we had to park further up the road and pay $20. I had paid extra for a corner room and when we were checking in we was told we are only booked into a standard room. After waiting for the guy behind reception to make a few calls, he eventually gave us the room we had paid for. The room was very nice and clean and had a great view. As it was a holiday weekend it was packed everywhere and at night alot of noise from the bar next door. This hotel was about 20 min walk to Santa Monica pier.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for price”
Reviews.Author: Taceycakes
Reviews.Content: The Cadillac had a good location for us because we wanted to check out Santa Monica but stay within a budget. The Santa Monica Pier is walking walking distance from The Cadillac. We checked in late which was a mess b/c the parking lot was full. The front desk guy took care of our car for us though. That was nice. In the morning we couldn't get out b/c they had to park a car behind us. We had to get help from the front desk again. They guy was very nice and helpful. We just prefer not to deal with that type of thing on vacation. We got upgraded without request and the room had a full kitchen and a queen bed plus bunk beds. We didn't need all that but it would be nice for a longer stay with kids. The kitchen had all brand new appliances and the other decor was modern. We were surprised that there was no A/C but luckily it was cool outside so we could open the windows. We were worried about the noise but the only thing that woke me up was the darn pigeons. The boardwalk noise was surprisingly quiet in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but yet not so nice.”
Reviews.Author: WayneBullet
Reviews.Content: Location to the beach is AWESOME! Location for parking AWFUL. Location for bums AWFUL and downright scary. I read the reviews and thought oh it is Venice what do you expect. Um, yeah, expect homeless to be around in full force. The place is right by a parking lot in which you can park your RV. And what passes for an RV is pretty liberal. My wife and I got to the beach just as the sun was setting. We wanted to jump out get checked in and get pictures of the beach before it was dark. We get checked in and quick, the front desk guy was awesome. Then he gives me my parking pass. We go back there. I had a rental, a compact Hyundai Elantra. I could not get parked in. There were pick ups in this area, no way. It was barely wide enough for 2 compacts let alone pick ups to be in there. Go back to the front and the guy at the front desk says he will park it for me. Man I was nervous. So we left him the keys and he did it. I have no idea how. My wife and I walked down the beach on the sunset to Santa Monica pier. It was awesome. As we walked down, the more scary it got though. The walk back was terrifying. People coming out of the shadows. We get back to the room. It was ok. We paid around $120 for the night. I would say it is well worth it for the location to the beach alone. The room was huge. For whatever reason we got the room with bunk beds and a full size bed, it might have been a queen but it seemed more full. The TV was a new HD, nice. We could not figure out if there was ac there or not. The room was hot. We were both so tired from the day we didn't feel like dealing with it. Just opened the window and it was fine. We paid $7 for Wifi which isn't bad. I said to my wife, you know this room does not seem like a hotel, seems more like we are staying at a friends spare bedroom. Take that for what it is, but she agreed with me. We both slept ok. Got checked out ok. Then the parking lot strikes again. Somebody had parked right behind me. We had to be at the airport in an hour. Some people had the same problem so they had left keys with the front desk. Only the person right behind me hadn't. So we had to wait about 15 minutes for them to get them out to move it.

Reviews.Title: “Historic and Fun!”
Reviews.Author: Cheristravels
Reviews.Content: We did our trip to Venice and The cadillac on a whim and it turned out to be a really fun sleepover visit with the family. The hotel is almost a hundred years old and sits on amazing area of Venice. Its got good eats on the corner and over priced mini mart. But its nice to have anything you need right there is a plus. Rooms are clean, the oceanfront views are some of the best Ive seen for the price. The staff... well, they went out of theyre way to make sure we had EVERYTHING we needed, they were kind and curtious and friendly and super fun! My shout out to Nikky.. Thanks for the use of youre pool stick! I would recommend this place to my friends and family... and we sure will stay at the cadillac when were in Venice again! : } ~

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room for the price!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleZubidoo
Reviews.Content: Extremely friendly and helpful staff, great location and room. The room was clean with a gorgeous view of the water. During they day you get the feel of Venice by hearing the drums and crowds in the background and by night time it was very quiet. If you want to experience Venice beach, this is the place to stay! Walk out the hotel door and you are in the middle of it! We'll be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise...”
Reviews.Author: peacesasa7
Reviews.Content: When I first walked into the Cadillac Hotel, I must say, I was questioning wether or not it was a good choice. When you first walk in it looks more like a hostel than a hotel. But once I got up to my room I was pleasantly surprised. I had a corner room and the views were excellent. The room was very clean and the bathroom looked as though it had never been used. The staff was very helpful with my luggage and answered any questions i had about the area. There's a small market across the street and a nice restaurant/cafe that both came in very handy. The location was very good. You could walk to the santa monica pier and Main Street. I saw a comment about 'bums', be advised that Venice Beach has many homeless people and is full of all kinds of characters. If you are uncomfortable with that then you should find a different area to stay in, not a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value and extremely clean!”
Reviews.Author: brazilianmomma
Reviews.Content: We had the most enjoyable stay at the Cadillac Hotel! My daughter and I were there this past week and were very pleased with everything. The hotel was clean, centrally located, and the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. We will DEFINITELY recommend this hotel to our friends and we will always make plans to stay there when we are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: trickyfaerie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Cadillac for 4 nights this past weekend, despite the negative reviews here. And I am SO glad I did! The hotel is a short trip from LAX, and in the most amazing location- literally steps from the sand. I booked a queen ocean view- and that is EXACTLY what I got! I could see the ocean from all 3 of the 3 windows in my room on the 3rd floor. Reading the other reviews, I was a bit wary of the noise from outside, but it was nothing compared to that you would hear from any hotel in a big city. I, personally, enjoyed the fact that after a long day of wandering, I could open my window and hear the live bands at Venice Bistro mix with the sounds of the surf, without having to go down the crowded bar. The hotel itself was quiet- I barely saw or heard another guest the entire weekend. I even had the rooftop to myself every morning for the perfect view of the sunrise. My room was very clean upon arrival, and kept that way by the housekeeping staff. The front desk staff were helpful in providing me with the information I needed, and very friendly. The only issue I had was that the first morning, my window next to the fire escape was left open by the cleaning staff. I had come back right after they finished my room, though, so I closed it in time. I placed a note on the window the next morning, and had no issues after that. I am planning another venture to Venice, and I won't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Right on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: travelinbunny
Reviews.Content: My husband and I extended a business trip to Los Angeles, moving hotels from downtown LA to the beach. Venice Beach appears to be the only place in Los Angeles that we can afford to stay and this time (after our initial attempt proved to be an utter failure) we found a part of Venice Beach that we actually like. The location of the Cadillac Hotel was perfect for us. Had the weather been nicer (it rained and was in the low-50's) our trip to Los Angeles would've been perfect! We didn't let the rain stop us from walking along the beach to the Santa Monica Pier. We played a bit in Santa Monica and then walked back to the hotel. The restaurant across the alley from the hotel had a good happy hour and was fun. The food was decent. I enjoyed the French fries. We had a wonderful view of the ocean from our hotel room. The hotel room itself was a bit sparse but it had a comfortable bed and a nice TV. There wasn't much provided in terms of bathroom supplies either, but we managed. No waste at this hotel. The front desk area is a little drab and the dude at the front desk wasn't overly friendly but he was nice (and there from about 4PM to 12PM the following day--that's a long day).

Reviews.Title: “worse experience i ahve ever had in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: michal20
Reviews.Content: the rooms are small, the staff was so unfriendly or helpful. the location was beyond terrible. there were bumbs and homeless people everywhare you turn... there was noise the entire night i could not sleep a bit. the doors keept slamming... i would never stay here again even if they paid me.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: leanne_janine
Reviews.Content: nice moden rooms, recently reformed, the staff weren't very friendly or helpful and they could have a restaurant instead of a big empty room with sofas and a tv in it. the location is great right on the boardwalk, venice beach has to be been seen its beautiful with loads of palm trees.. the people are very strange not we never felt afraid the venice bistro is great! really nice people just round the corner on the front.. they have live music on every night and it soon became our local! the sunsets are amazing there is a supermarket directly opposite the entrance which was very handy there was some problems when we came to pay as the price they had quoted on the internet didn' t include some kind of tax.. but what can you do? so we paid

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in venice”
Reviews.Author: mingo9
Reviews.Content: i am a recording artist frequently working in Los Angeles, having friends living in Venice i often stay at there houses while working, whenever i need some time for myself i will go to Cadillac Hotel as it is located beautifully on beach, i have always been happy staying there but this year i was greatly surprised walking in, the good vibes from the receptionist and staff really made me feel welcome, good and safe, all the rooms was renovated in a nice simple and clean style, the prices was even cheaper than before for some reason, i had some problems with my computer and the manager would go out of her way helping me with whatever she could, the building itself has a great vibe to it, maybe the history of this Hotel still spreads the vibe of classical Venice artistery, Charles Chaplin was staying there agin and agin, Jim Morrison was hanging out and jamming there, its a historic Venice Hotel indeed, i always liked that Hotel and i am happy to experince the upgrade this year, if you are visiting Venice i suggest you check out Cadillac Hotel and experince for yourself. thanks ! F. Lauritsen

Reviews.Title: “What a great value...ON THE BEACH!”
Reviews.Author: LaneMichelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a romantic get-away and will not be going any place else in LA ever again! Simple and clean...rooms have a flat screen TV and nice fridge. I love that they use eco friendly products. If you stay here don't miss the view from the roof-top balcony at sun-set!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beach Side Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Ryan_James9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the Cadillac Hotel for four days. The friendly staff was amazing. They were able to give some great local tips for dining and evening entertainment. Our room had an ocean view and we enjoyed walks on the Venice walkway right out the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad rooms, bad parking, safety concerns”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyCochran
Reviews.Content: Great location! Crappy small hotel at a BIG price! Worse than a cheap Motel 6, PARKING SITUATION IS ABSURD! Dont let anybody fool you....... they have safety issues.

Reviews.Title: “VERY COOL, VERY TRENDY.”
Reviews.Author: murph36
Reviews.Content: This was the last hotel i stayed in before i went back to ireland and what a way to go. Slap bang in the middle of Venice beach with all the streetlife at your fingertips. Rooms are basice but spotless (get the gueen corner room) but you wont be in it long with all the action going on outside. No room service but again, you wont need it. Have to say, this was one of the highlights of my trip. Be back soon...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Poor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Swissaroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights after 3 weeks of travel thru the western US. This hotel was th worst!! Stay on 3rd floor. As mentioned in earlier reviews, it is very noisy! The windows and doors are probably from the 40's... Not isolation whatsoever! You either get the wakeup call from the homeless on the strip or the cleaning stuff shouting on the floor. The bed sheets are full of spots (brown and red). The rooms have been renovated, but without any taste: a bed, a chair, a desk and a TV. No colors, just no taste. The carpet seems to be new, but looks like 20 years old. Full of spots.The cleaning personel puts the new towels on the toilet because there is nowhere else to keep them. The lobby has also all kind of new furniture but that's it. No plants, no decoration.... just cold. Same goes for the large roof terrace. With a little effort this could be a great lounge or place to hang around (look at Venicesuites.com), they made it! It's a shame. The management could do much more of this location and building with just a bit of taste!! It doesn't cost much! They don't seem to care and just live from there location. Thanks god we had a Special deal for 99$/night! This was already overpaid. Will not return! Try hotelerwin.com

Reviews.Title: “Take earplugs - if the crazies don't keep up awake, cleaning machines will....”
Reviews.Author: Keira58
Reviews.Content: We had a room with a great view - fantastic. Unfortunately - and not the fault of the Cadillac Hotel - it rained solidly for the two days we were there (who wrote "It never rains in southern California?") - it was difficult to see anything through the relentless rain. A disproportionate number of crazies enjoyed camping outside, using the seats and tables thoughtfully provided by the local authority.
